name: 劉宛育
objective: The course attempts to give an introduction to important architectural thoughts, events and projects after modernism. From structuralism to blobitecture, each week a lecture referring to one specific topic including relevant materials will be given.
schedule:
Week 01: Introduction
Week 02: Futurism & Space Age
Week 03: Expressionism & Neo-expressionism
Week 04: Constructivism & Deconstructivism
Week 05: Structuralism & Metabolism
Week 06: Postmodernism & Post-postmodernism
Week 07: Prefabrication
Week 08: Radical architecture
Week 09: Mid-term
Week 10: Bionic architecture
Week 11: Blob architecture
Week 12: Blob architecture II
Week 13: Media architecture
Week 14: Digital architecture?
Week 15: Contemporary architecture in Latin America
Week 16: Contemporary architecture in the rest of the world
Week 17: Conclusion
Week 18: Final
scorePolicy:
Attendance: 15%
Four essays: each one 15% (15% x4= 60%)
Final writing: 25%
materials:
Conrads, Ulrich (1975) Programs and Manifestoes on 20th-Century Architecture. The MIT Press.
Ockman, Joan (1993) Architecture Culture: 1943-1968. Rizzoli International Publications.
Jencks & Kropf (2006). Theories and Manifestoes of Contemporary Architecture (2nd ed.). Academy Press.
Hays, K. Michael (2000). Architecture Theory Since 1968. The MIT Press.
Nesbitt, Kate (1996). Theorizing a New Agenda for Architecture: An Anthology of Architectural Theory 1965-1995 (2nd ed.). Princeton Architectural Press.
Sykes & Hays (2010). Constructing a New Agenda: Architecture Theory 1993-2009. Princeton Architectural Press.
Braham & Hale (2006). Rethinking Technology: A Reader in Architectural Theory. Routledge.
